docs.lead_paragraph: CAMBRIDGE PLAN INTERNATIONAL, producer of one of the latest in fad diets, has sought protection from creditors under Federal bankruptcy laws, citing competition from imitators and sharply dwindling sales amid negative publicity about the diet's potential dangers. A few months before filing for bankruptcy, the company said that six million Americans had used the very-low-calorie formula known as the Cambridge Diet. Under the bankruptcy filing, the diet continues to be sold through a network of self-styled nutrition counselors. Company executives say business has even improved. Apparently, it takes more than bankruptcy, reports of deaths and hospitalizations and a detailed health warning on the product itself to deter dieters who are eager to shed unwanted pounds quickly and easily.
